meanings.definition: A mark or symbol of quality or excellence.
meanings.sent1: The gold seal was a hallmark of the prestigious award.
meanings.sent2: The shiny badge was a hallmark of the top performer.
meanings.sent3: The clown's red nose became a hallmark of his comedic routine.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the hallmark of her character, shining brightly in every interaction.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile she wore was a hallmark of her joyful personality.

meanings.sent1: The unique design was the hallmark of the new product.
meanings.sent2: The tower's height was a hallmark of the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: His loud laugh became a hallmark of the office, echoing through the halls.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse stood as a hallmark of the coastal town, guiding ships home.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of freshly baked bread was a hallmark of the bakery's success.

meanings.definition: To mark or stamp with a hallmark.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler would hallmark each piece with a tiny stamp.
meanings.sent2: Before selling, they would hallmark the silverware with their logo.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to hallmark his paintings with a unique signature.
meanings.sent4: She would hallmark her pottery creations with a special symbol.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith would hallmark his swords with intricate designs.
